content.description:
Start on the left side of the boulder matched on a rail. Traverse out the lip of the boulder on slopers until you are in the middle of the lip, then make an incredibly hard mantel on nothing but a heel and friction. Good luck!

I am no judge of grade, but this was hard.

I would park at the marked spots at the intersection, and walk up the road. It would take about 3 minutes.
content.location: This is next to the road on the left just after the DH campground/Rampart Rd. 3 way. *giggity. It is on a right turn corner.

content.description:
Start with a palm down on a friction sloper and a high foot on a little nubbin. Establish yourself. This is the hardest part. Stand tall to a feature, work up your feet, and attain the top of the slab.

I love this problem. My friend, however, has never made it off the ground. Lol.

There could be more problems around here, but the rock quality is not that great, and there probably are not too many more.
content.location: This is at the exit of the Cabin Ridge camping area that is on the left side of the road.

climbs.name: Jabba Ate a Mushroom
climbs.fa: ? This is right next to the road

content.description:
Start on the right side of the boulder on good holds.  Traverse left on good holds and a crack kinda thing until you are on the slightly overhanging side of the boulder.  Go up at this point.

This is a chossy problem. It is also not good at all.
content.location: There is a pulloff, lookout, rock thingy just past Anarchy Area that has marked parking. Park and look right. The giant, chossy blob is your objective.

content.description:
Start sitting on good crimps. Make a couple moves up and left, then make your way into the dihedral thingy. Use crimps and pinches on this feature and the face to get into a gaston. From this point, get a high foot, and go for the top. This is super fun.

It is not visible from the parking, walk about 20 feet through a notch. This climbs the left side of the main feature on the lookout with the tree. There is a hole near the landing area that would be a bad drop, but on this problem, no falls got anywhere near it. Just don't let it get into your head.

I believe this is a must do.
content.location:
Park the same as for

Jabba Ate a Mushroom

.

content.description: Start on the bomber undercling just beneath the seam, and make a couple moves left and up to gain some slopers. Get ready to get those hands feeling good, and put those feet up for a fun and slightly exciting mantel. The top block is off!!!
content.location: It is really obvious from the road. There is a little pulloff. This is close to the first big picnic area.

content.description:
Sit start with your hands in the crack, work hard to move left in the crack, and gain the undercling. Top out the same as

Adirondack Slap

, or continue left, and finish at the top.
content.location:
It starts the same as

Adirondack Slap

.
